thread.title: This legendary Boston band may finally earn a place in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame - Entertainment
thread.title_full: This legendary Boston band may finally earn a place in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame - Entertainment

author: boston.com
title: This legendary Boston band may finally earn a place in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame - Entertainment
text:
Ebet Roberts/Redferns/Getty The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame announced its 2016 nominations today, and among them was legendary Boston new wave rockers The Cars.
This is The Cars’ (and seven other bands’) first nomination. The complete list also includes:
Chic
Chicago
Cheap Trick
Deep Purple
Janet Jackson
The J.B.’s
Chaka Khan
Los Lobos
Steve Miller
Nine Inch Nails
N.W.A.
The Smiths
The Spinners
Yes
Just because a band is nominated doesn’t mean that they will be inducted. A committee of about 800 industry professionals will vote to decide who gets inducted. Usually six to eight bands will get the nod, and the announcement comes in December.
Fans can also vote for their favorite nominees on the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame website starting today. Just FYI: The fan vote counts for less than one percent of the overall vote.
If inducted, The Cars will join Aerosmith, Donna Summer, and more as Boston representatives in the Hall of Fame.
